blockquote.p: Our Digital Transformation Initiative puts a focus on innovation by allowing us to more quickly develop and execute on new ideas. Innovation is the driving force that allows us to improve engagement with existing customers, and to explore new markets.

The Digital Transformation Initiative will turn us into the industry leader by allowing us to interact with our customers more easily and more frequently. By increasing the number of customer touchpoints and using the resulting feedback to quickly and relentlessly adapt and improve our offerings, we will turn into the market leader within the next three years.

title.a: Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules

ul.li: Famous small set of SOA design rules
Teams must expose functionality through services
Communication happens only through service interfaces
There are no hard guidelines for service design
Internal/external service is a matter of policy, not one of design
Going against the let's pick a platform spirit of old-school SOA
Decoupling implementations at design-time and at runtime

slide.title: Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Consequences

ul.li: With more freedom comes more responsibility
Monitoring and metrics are necessary for finding root causes
All APIs must be hardened against DoS attacks
Automated QA is necessary to really understand service health
Services must be documented and registered so that they can be discovered
Debugging becomes harder because of service dependencies
Sophisticated tooling required to manage the new SOA landscape
Much easier in today's technology landscape than 15 years ago
Services are the concepts that provide business value
Decomposing organizations in composable services makes management easier
APIs are the technical representation of services
Application Programming Interface (API) as a programmable service representation
UIs are the human-oriented representation of APIs
User Interface (UI) for allowing human users access to a service through an API
Every organizations uses APIs in their IT landscape
One of the oldest variations of the theme may be file exchange/transfer
Point-to-point integrations created for specific integration needs
How many of these integrations would have been useful for reuse?
Integrations identify connectivity that creates value
API-enabled value chains are more valuable
Evolve components without the need for coordination
Connect new components without changes to the API provider side
Every product must have a digital shadow (represented as API)
Products without APIs cannot be (easily) used in value chains
API First makes sure that product APIs are first-class citizens
(product interactions are API-based)
(iterate designs and gather feedback)
(using products should be self-service)
Digital Transformation needs an API Strategy
API Strategy needs an API Program
